member.name: T:Xunit.StaFactAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an xunit test that starts on an STA thread. Tests will be Skipped on non-Windows operating systems.
member.remarks: The test does *not* apply a , so an async test will resume on a standard MTA thread from the thread pool. To get an STA thread even after awaiting expressions, use .

member.name: T:Xunit.StaTheoryAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an xunit theory that starts on an STA thread. Tests will be Skipped on non-Windows operating systems.
member.remarks: The test does *not* apply a , so an async test will resume on a standard MTA thread from the thread pool. To get an STA thread even after awaiting expressions, use .

member.name: M:Xunit.TplExtensions.NoThrowAwaitable(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an awaitable for the specified task that will never throw, even if the source task faults or is canceled.
member.param: The task whose completion should signal the completion of the returned awaitable.
if set to the continuation will be scheduled on the caller's context; to always execute the continuation on the threadpool.

member.name: T:Xunit.UIFactAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an xunit test that starts on a UI thread-like such that awaited expressions resume on the test's "main thread". On Windows, the test runs on an STA thread.

member.name: P:Xunit.UISettingsAttribute.MaxAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retry attempts for a test.

item.description: Leave unset to inherit the value from an attribute applied to a containing type (the ultimate default being 1)
1 to not retry the test on failure
An explicit value greater than 1 to retry the test up to a total of this many attempts on failure
